Question_1.Context: In the study, what was the primary aim regarding the development of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595?
Question_1.Question: What was the primary aim of the study regarding the development of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595?
Question_1.A: To characterise the in vitro behaviour of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in PDAC cells.
Question_1.B: To perform a dosimetric assessment of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595.
Question_1.C: To evaluate the therapeutic effect of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in MUC1-CE expressing PDAC cells.
Question_1.D: To conduct a preliminary cross-calibration of detectors for the clinical implementation of Ac-225.
Question_1.Source: In this study, we developed and characterised the in vitro behaviour of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in PDAC cells with varying levels of MUC1-CE expression.

Question_2.Context: What was the secondary aim of the study regarding [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595?
Question_2.Question: What was the secondary aim of the study regarding [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595?
Question_2.A: To evaluate the therapeutic effect of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in MUC1-CE expressing PDAC cells.
Question_2.B: To perform a dosimetric assessment of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595.
Question_2.C: To characterise the in vitro behaviour of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in PDAC cells.
Question_2.D: To conduct a preliminary cross-calibration of detectors for the clinical implementation of Ac-225.
Question_2.Source: As a secondary aim, a radioanalytical assessment of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 was performed to calibrate detection of alpha, beta, and gamma emissions resulting from Ac-225 decay as preparation for clinical implementation.

Question_3.Context: What was observed in terms of cell binding of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_3.Question: What was observed in terms of cell binding of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_3.A: Binding to PANC-1 was significantly lower than all other cell lines.
Question_3.B: Binding to BxPC-3 was significantly greater than all other cell lines.
Question_3.C: Binding to PANC-1 was significantly greater than all other cell lines.
Question_3.D: Binding to CAPAN-1 was significantly lower than all other cell lines.
Question_3.Source: Binding to PANC-1 was significantly greater than all other cell lines at concentrations of 50 – 300 nM.

Question_4.Context: What was the observed internalisation pattern of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_4.Question: What was the observed internalisation pattern of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_4.A: Internalisation was significantly higher in BxPC-3 compared to PANC-1.
Question_4.B: Internalisation was significantly higher in PANC-1 and AsPC-1 compared to BxPC-3 and CAPAN-1.
Question_4.C: Internalisation was significantly higher in CAPAN-1 compared to PANC-1.
Question_4.D: Internalisation was significantly higher in AsPC-1 compared to PANC-1.
Question_4.Source: PANC-1 and AsPC-1 cell lines demonstrated significantly higher levels of internalisation compared to BxPC-3 and CAPAN-1 cell lines.

Question_5.Context: What was the effect of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 on γH2AX foci in the study?
Question_5.Question: What was the effect of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 on γH2AX foci in the study?
Question_5.A: Significantly more AsPC-1 cells exhibited γH2AX foci compared to PANC-1 cells.
Question_5.B: Significantly more PANC-1 cells exhibited γH2AX foci compared to AsPC-1 cells.
Question_5.C: No significant differences were identified in the percentage of γH2AX foci between cell lines.
Question_5.D: No cells exhibited γH2AX foci in response to [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595.
Question_5.Source: One-hour following [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 exposure significantly more PANC-1 cells exhibited γH2AX foci than AsPC-1 cells.

Question_6.Context: What was the observed clonogenic survival pattern in response to [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_6.Question: What was the observed clonogenic survival pattern in response to [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_6.A: PANC-1 cells exhibited significantly higher survival compared to AsPC-1 cells at all concentrations.
Question_6.B: AsPC-1 cells exhibited significantly higher survival compared to PANC-1 cells at all concentrations.
Question_6.C: No significant differences were identified in the survival of PANC-1 and AsPC-1 cells.
Question_6.D: Both PANC-1 and AsPC-1 cells had 100% survival at all concentrations.
Question_6.Source: At low concentrations of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595, survival of PANC-1 cells was lower than AsPC-1 cells.

Question_7.Context: What was the purpose of the dosimetric assessment conducted in the study?
Question_7.Question: What was the purpose of the dosimetric assessment conducted in the study?
Question_7.A: To estimate the dose-rate of 1 kBq of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 with consideration to alpha particles.
Question_7.B: To evaluate the therapeutic effect of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in MUC1-CE expressing PDAC cells.
Question_7.C: To characterise the in vitro behaviour of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in PDAC cells.
Question_7.D: To perform a preliminary cross-calibration of detectors for the clinical implementation of Ac-225.
Question_7.Source: A dosimetric assessment was performed to estimate the dose-rate of 1 kBq of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 with consideration to alpha particles.

Question_8.Context: What was the outcome of the cross-calibration of detectors in the study?
Question_8.Question: What was the outcome of the cross-calibration of detectors in the study?
Question_8.A: The detectors showed inconsistent results, leading to the need for recalibration.
Question_8.B: The detectors were unable to detect any emissions from Ac-225 decay.
Question_8.C: A strong linear correlation was established between the detectors.
Question_8.D: The detectors were found to be incompatible with the emissions from Ac-225 decay.
Question_8.Source: Cross-calibration of the HPGD and Automatic Gamma Counter resulted in a strong linear correlation.

Question_9.Context: What was the observed pattern of alpha, beta, and gamma emissions from Ac-225 decay in the study?
Question_9.Question: What was the observed pattern of alpha, beta, and gamma emissions from Ac-225 decay in the study?
Question_9.A: Alpha emissions were approximately 4 times higher than beta and gamma emissions.
Question_9.B: Beta emissions were the most dominant compared to alpha and gamma emissions.
Question_9.C: Gamma emissions were the most dominant compared to alpha and beta emissions.
Question_9.D: Alpha, beta, and gamma emissions were all equal in intensity.
Question_9.Source: Using Ludlum 3030p and Thermo RadEYE B-20 dosimeters, the measured alpha particle fluence was approximately 4 times higher than beta and gamma fluence.

Question_10.Context: What was the conclusion drawn regarding the potential of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_10.Question: What was the conclusion drawn regarding the potential of [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 in the study?
Question_10.A: The study concluded that [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 had no therapeutic effect on PDAC cells.
Question_10.B: The study concluded that [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 showed promising results in targeting MUC1-CE expressing PDAC cells.
Question_10.C: The study concluded that [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 was ineffective in inducing DNA damage in PDAC cells.
Question_10.D: The study concluded that [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 had toxic effects on normal pancreatic cells.
Question_10.Source: In this study, we demonstrated that the C595 monoclonal antibody can be labelled to Ac-225 and maintain high MUC1-CE binding and internalisation. [225Ac]Ac-DOTA-C595 demonstrated a strong therapeutic effect on PDAC cells by inducing γH2AX foci in most treated cells.
